sen.j: 堂本 印象（どうもと いんしょう、1891年12月25日 - 1975年9月5日）は日本画家。
sen.e: Insho DOMOTO (December 25, 1891 - September 5, 1975) was a Japanese-style painting artist.
Insho DOMOTO (December 25, 1891 - September 5, 1975) was a Japanese-style painting artist.
Insho DOMOTO (December 25, 1891 - September 5, 1975) was a Japanese-style painting artist.

sen.j: 帝室技芸員。
sen.e: A member of Teishitsugigeiin.
He was a member of Teishitsugigeiin.
He was a Teishitsu Gigeiin (Imperial art expert).
sen.cmt: a member of Teishitsugigeiin→a Teishitsu Gigeiinとし、補足を追加

sen.j: 芸術院会員。
sen.e: A member of the Japan Art Academy.
He was a member of the Japan Art Academy.
He was a member of the Japan Art Academy.

sen.j: 京都府生れ。
sen.e: Born in Kyoto Prefecture.
He was born in Kyoto Prefecture.
He was born in Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 本名：堂本三之助。
sen.e: Autonym: Sannosuke DOMOTO
Autonym: Sannosuke DOMOTO
Autonym: Sannosuke DOMOTO.

sen.j: 1910年（明治43）、京都市立銅駝美術工芸高等学校卒業後、西陣織の図案描きの仕事をしていたが、日本画家を志して京都市立芸術大学に入学。
sen.e: After graduating from Kyoto City Dohda Senior High School Of Arts, Insho was drawing designs of Nishijin-brocade but subsequently enrolled in Kyoto City University of Arts in 1919 with an aspiration to become a Japanese-style painting artist.

After graduating from Kyoto City Dohda Senior High School Of Arts, Insho was drawing designs of Nishijin-brocade but subsequently enrolled in Kyoto City University of Arts in 1919 with the aspiration of becoming a Japanese-style painting artist.

After graduating from Kyoto City Dohda Senior High School Of Arts, Insho was drawing designs of Nishijin-brocade but subsequently enrolled in Kyoto City University of Arts in 1910 with the aspiration of becoming a Japanese-style painting artist.

sen.j: 1919年（大正8）、帝展初出展作「深草」が入選した。
sen.e: In 1919, his first entry "Fukakusa" was accepted by the Japan Art Academy Exhibition (Teiten)"
In 1919, his first entry, Fukakusa, was accepted by the Japan Art Academy Exhibition (Teiten).
In 1919, his first entry, 'Fukakusa,' was accepted by the Japan Art Academy Exhibition (Teiten).
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせ、クォーテーション追加

sen.j: 帝展第3回展では「調鞠図」で特選、第6回展に出展した「華厳」は帝国美術院賞を受賞するなど第一級の日本画家として認められた。
sen.e: "Chokikuzu" won a special commendation at the Third Teiten and "Kegon" won the Japan Art Prize(Teikoku Bijutsuinsho) at the Sixth Teiten, establishing himself as among the top Japanese artists.

His work, Chokikuzu, won a special commendation at the Third Teiten and Kegon won the Japan Art Prize(Teikoku Bijutsuinsho) at the Sixth Teiten, establishing himself as among the top Japanese artists.

His work, 'Chokikuzu,' won a special commendation at the Third Teiten and 'Kegon' won the Japan Art Prize (Teikoku Bijutsuinsho) at the Sixth Teiten, establishing himself as among the top Japanese artists.
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせクォーテーション追加、スペース追加

sen.j: また、私塾東丘社の主催者として、画壇の指導者としても活躍した。
sen.e: He also played an active role as the organizer of his private art school Tokyusha as well as a leader of the art circle.
He also played an active role as the organizer of his private art school, Tokyusha, as well as being the leader of an art circle.
He also played an active role as the organizer of his private art school, Tokyusha, as well as being the leader of an art circle.

sen.j: 戦後、抽象表現や障壁画の世界にも活躍の場を広げ、国際展覧会に多くの作品を出展するなど国際的にも活躍。
sen.e: After the World War 2, he expanded his artistic horizon to include abstract expressions and murals and, in addition, took an active part in the international art scene by entering numerous works into the various international exhibits.

After World War II, he expanded his artistic horizons to include abstract expressions and murals and, in addition, took an active part in the international art scene by entering numerous works into various international exhibits.

After World War II, he expanded his artistic horizons to include abstract expressions and murals and, in addition, took an active part in the international art scene by entering numerous works into various international exhibits.

sen.j: 1961年（昭和36）には文化勲章を、1963年（昭和38）には大阪カテドラル聖マリア大聖堂 に壁画『栄光の聖母マリア』を描いた功績によりローマ教皇ヨハネス23世より聖シルベストロ文化第一勲章を受章した。
sen.e: He was decorated with the Order of Culture in 1961 and, in 1963, received the Order of St. Sylvester from Pope John the 23rd in recognition of his work "The Glories of Virgin Mary Murals" in Grand Cathedral of Virgin Mary of Osaka.

He was decorated with the Order of Culture in 1961 and, in 1963, received the Order of St. Sylvester from Pope John the 23rd in recognition of his work, The Glories of Virgin Mary Murals, in the Grand Cathedral of Virgin Mary of Osaka.

He was decorated with the Order of Culture in 1961 and, in 1963, received the Order of St. Sylvester from Pope John the 23rd in recognition of his work, "The Glories of Virgin Mary" Murals, in the Grand Cathedral of Virgin Mary of Osaka.
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせ、クォーテーション追加
